basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I am Prakash Harvani, a Senior Software Engineer with 6+ years of experience in the IT industry, specializing in full-stack development and system architecture design. I have a strong track record of building scalable, high-performance applications from scratch, owning end-to-end product development and technical strategy.
basic_info.description1: My core technical expertise includes NestJS, Node.js, GraphQL (Federation), Next.js, React.js, and Angular, along with extensive experience in relational and NoSQL databases such as PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Couchbase. I am proficient in cloud-native development, working with AWS services (Lambda, S3, EventBridge, MediaConvert, CloudWatch, Scheduler, and more) as well as Azure services.
basic_info.description2: I have hands-on experience with containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes, and I actively leverage observability tools like New Relic and Splunk to ensure system reliability, performance, and scalability.
basic_info.description3: Beyond development, I have been responsible for system architecture design, workflow and platform strategy, and technical decision-making, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver robust solutions.
basic_info.description4: I have worked across diverse domains, including Retail, E-commerce, News & Media, Property Rent/Sale, Social Media, Education, Food Delivery, and Web3 ecosystems such as decentralized wallets, P2P trading bots, NFT marketplaces, and crypto exchanges.

projects.title: Yield Farming
projects.description: Yield farming is the process of using decentralized finance (DeFi) to maximize returns. Users lend or borrow crypto on a DeFi platform and earn cryptocurrency in return for their services..

projects.title: Liquidity pools
projects.description: Liquidity pools are one of the foundational technologies behind the current DeFi ecosystem. They are an essential part of automated market makers (AMM), borrow-lend protocols, yield farming, synthetic assets, on-chain insurance, blockchain gaming â€“ the list goes on.

projects.title: Exchanges & NFT marketplaces
projects.description: A cryptocurrency exchange, or a digital currency exchange (DCE), is a business that allows customers to trade cryptocurrencies or digital currencies for other assets, such as conventional fiat money or other digital currencies. NFT or Non-Fungible Tokens are cryptographic assets that are created on blockchain technology, and have unique identification codes and meta-data, which makes them distinguishable, distinct, and completely unique.In fact, even cryptocurrencies are not distinct, since they are identical to one another. This is the reason that they can be traded at equivalency for commercial usage, but not NFT, which are 100% unique.

projects.title: ICO/IDO Launchpads
projects.description: An initial coin offering (ICO) or initial currency offering is a type of funding using cryptocurrencies. It is often a form of crowdfunding, although a private ICO which does not seek public investment is also possible. In an ICO, a quantity of cryptocurrency is sold in the form of 'tokens' ('coins') to speculators or investors, in exchange for legal tender or other (generally established and more stable) cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin or Ether. The tokens are promoted as future functional units of currency if or when the ICO's funding goal is met and the project successfully launches.

projects.title: Crypto Wallets & P2P wallets
projects.description: P2P crypto exchange is a platform where a buyer directly pays to the seller. Sometimes itâ€™s also called decentralized exchange as the platform only serves as a matching and routing layer for trade orders; it does not hold customersâ€™ funds, and no third party controls it. In other words â€œOnce you are in a P2P exchange platform you are definitely using the P2P wallet.
